titleStmt.title: A Godlye and holesome preseruatyue against desperatiõ at all times necessarye for the soule but then chiefly to be bled and ministred when the deuill doth assault us moost fiercely, and deth approcheth niest.

publicationStmt.publisher: By James Burtel, dwellyng without the northe gate of Paules in the corner house of Pater noster rowe openinge into Chepesyde,

notesStmt.note: Running title: A preseruatiue against desperation.

Reproduction of original in the Harvard University. Library.
